title: Kurt Vonnegut - Novels, Stories, Essays & Letters (29 books)
description:
KURT VONNEGUT, JR. (1922-2007) was an American writer, humanist and pacifist intellectual.  His works such as CAT'S CRADLE (1963), SLAUGHTERHOUSE-FIVE (1969), and BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS (1973) blend satire, gallows humor, and science fiction.  The New York Times headline following Vonnegut's death called him "the counterculture's novelist."

In addition to containing all Vonnegut's classic novels, this torrent includes several collections of short stories, essays, speeches and other assorted works (some published posthumously), plus the recently published letters.


The following books are in ePUB format (almost entirely retail quality):

* 2BR02B (Floating Press, 2002).

* ARMAGEDDON IN RETROSPECT & Other New and Unpublished Writings on War and Peace (Putnams, 2008).  Introduction by Mark Vonnegut.

* BAGOMBO SNUFF BOX: Uncollected Short Fiction (1999; rep. RosettaBooks, 2011).

* BASIC TRAINING (RosettaBooks, 2012).

* BLUEBEARD: The Autobiography of Rabo Karabekian (1916-1988) (Random House, 1987).

* BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS, or Goodbye Blue Monday (Random House, 1973).

* CAT'S CRADLE (Random House, 1963).

* DEADEYE DICK (Random House, 1982).

* GALAPAGOS (Random House, 1985).

* GOD BLESS YOU, DR. KEVORKIAN (Seven Stories, 2010).  Foreword by Neil Gaiman.

* GOD BLESS YOU, MR. ROSEWATER, or Pearls Before Swine (Delta, 1965).

* HAPPY BIRTHDAY, WANDA JUNE (Bantam, 1970).

* HOCUS POCUS (Berkley, 1990).

* IF THIS ISN'T NICE, WHAT IS? Advice for the Young (RosettaBooks, 2013).  Introduction by Dan Wakefield.

* JAILBIRD (Random House, 1979).

* LETTERS (Delacorte, 2012).  Edited with an Introduction by Dan Wakefield.

* LOOK AT THE BIRDIE: Unpublished Short Fiction (Random House, 2009).

* A MAN WITHOUT A COUNTRY (Seven Stories, 2005).  Edited by Daniel Simon.

* MOTHER NIGHT (Random House, 1974).

* PALM SUNDAY: An Autobiographical Collage (Random House, 1981).

* THE PETRIFIED ANTS (Delacorte, 2009).  With a Foreword by Sidney Offit.

* PLAYER PIANO (Random House, 1990).

* THE SIRENS OF TITAN (Random House, 1959).

* SLAPSTICK, or Lonesome No More! (Random House, 2004).

* SLAUGHTERHOUSE-FIVE, or The Children's Crusade (Random House, 1997).

* TIMEQUAKE (Berkley, 1997).

* WE ARE WHAT WE PRETEND TO BE: The First and Last Works (Vanguard, 2012).

* WELCOME TO THE MONKEY HOUSE (Delta, 1968).

* WHILE MORTALS SLEEP: Unpublished Short Fiction (Delacorte, 2011).
